discussion_comments.comment_body:
2 considerations:

1) I want users to know where the command comes from
2) I want to avoid naming conflicts

wdyt about a design like this?

`<extension name>.command`

e.g.

```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│ /gcp.run deploy         Deploy to Cloud Run         │
│ /firebase.deploy        Deploy all Firebase services│
│ /firebase.functions list List all Firebase Functions│
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -33,10 +33,36 @@ The `gemini-extension.json` file contains the configuration for the extension. T
 }
 ```
 
-- `name`: The name of the extension. This is used to uniquely identify the extension. This should match the name of your extension directory.
+- `name`: The name of the extension. This is used to uniquely identify the extension and will be used as the prefix for extension commands (e.g., `/ext:name:command`).
discussion_comments.comment_body:
after offline discussion:

 I've updated the implementation to behave like this:

  - Extension commands use standard naming (no prefix) by default
  - Only renamed to <extension>.command on conflict
  - All have [ExtensionName] tag in descriptions for identification

  Examples:

No conflict:
```
  /deploy                    [firebase] Deploy all Firebase services
  /run:deploy                [gcp] Deploy to Cloud Run
```

With conflict:
```
  /deploy                    Deploy to production (user command)
  /firebase.deploy           [firebase] Deploy all Firebase services
```


This keeps the common case (no conflicts) simple while handling conflicts gracefully. Extensions never override existing commands - they get renamed instead.

"hideTips": true
     ```
 
+- **`model`** (string)
+  - **Description:** Specifies the Gemini model to use.
+  - **Default:** Empty
+  - **Example:**
+    ```json
+    "model": "gemini-2.5-flash"
+    ```
+
+- **`auth`** (object)
+  - **Description:** Configures the authentication settings for Gemini and Vertex AI.
+  - **Default:** Empty
+  - **Properties:**
+    - **`gemini`** (object): Gemini-specific authentication settings.
+      - **`apiKey`** (string): Your API key for the Gemini API.
+    - **`vertex`** (object): Vertex AI-specific authentication settings.
+      - **`apiKey`** (string): Your Google Cloud API key.
+      - **`project`** (string): Your Google Cloud Project ID.
+      - **`location`** (string): Your Google Cloud Project Location (e.g., us-central1).
+  - **Example:**
+    ```json
+    "selectedAuthType": "oauth-personal", // oauth-personal, gemini-api-key, vertex-ai

discussion_comments.comment_body:
I think it's best to keep their naming consistent with the configuration items. For example, for vertex, just use vertex directly instead of vertex AI.


```suggestion
    "selectedAuthType": "oauth-personal", // oauth-personal, gemini-api, vertex
```

discussion_comments.comment_body:
Since [selectedAuthType is typed as AuthType](https://github.com/google-gemini/gemini-cli/blob/524ede52d23c2c2d400cde3a80aaf54ba669cd02/packages/cli/src/config/settings.ts#L42), we need to change the definition of [AuthType](https://github.com/google-gemini/gemini-cli/blob/524ede52d23c2c2d400cde3a80aaf54ba669cd02/packages/core/src/core/contentGenerator.ts#L37) simultaneously.
If we are going to do this anyway, I want to keep these more simple like:
```diff
 export enum AuthType {
-   LOGIN_WITH_GOOGLE = 'oauth-personal',
+   LOGIN_WITH_GOOGLE = 'oauth',
-   USE_GEMINI = 'gemini-api-key',
+   USE_GEMINI = 'gemini',
-   USE_VERTEX_AI = 'vertex-ai',
+   USE_VERTEX_AI = 'vertex',
 }
```
I'll do it later.
